block.p: In a surprise move, Henry Winterstern, who abruptly resigned as chairman of the independent studio First Look in March, has been named co-chairman of the studio, the company announced on Tuesday.

The studio has undergone a major executive shuffle and refinancing since last month, when Mr. Winterstern left in the wake of a financial squeeze, personnel issues and the failure of the studio's first three releases.

In a surprise move, Henry Winterstern, who abruptly resigned as chairman of the independent studio First Look in March, has been named co-chairman of the studio, the company announced on Tuesday.

The studio has undergone a major executive shuffle and refinancing since last month, when Mr. Winterstern left in the wake of a financial squeeze, personnel issues and the failure of the studio's first three releases.
Mr. Winterstern said he left because the board declined to finance his purchase of a production company to supply the company with more movies; the company did not give a reason at the time.
Since then, the independent film producer Nu Image acquired a controlling interest in First Look.
Avi Lerner, the co-chairman of Nu Image who joined forces to reacquire the company after Mr. Winterstern resigned, was named the other co-chairman of First Look on Tuesday.
Mr. Winterstern will focus on financing deals, while Mr. Lerner, whose company is mainly known for genre and thriller films, will concentrate on movie production and foreign financing.
